section.title: Functions detected by standard fault simulation payloads
section.para: Here is a full list of the payload modules that currently may be used for fault simulation, and the lists of the functions for which fault simulation is implemented by each module. For each function parameters, which may be used in the simulation scenario, are described.

For each functions is A function name in square brackets means that this function is detected only if it is exported by the kernel (it may or may not be exported in each particular system). Only one of the functions separated by a slash is detected depending on which one of them is actually exported by the kernel.

itemizedlist.listitem:
kedr_fsim_capable.ko
capable
Fault simulation point for this function provides the parameter 'cap' of type intfor fault simulation scenario.

kedr_fsim_user_space_access.ko
copy_to_user/_copy_to_user
copy_from_user/_copy_from_user
strndup_user memdup_user
Fault simulation points for this functions do not provide additional parameter for fault simulation scenario.

kedr_fsim_cmm.ko
__kmalloc krealloc __krealloc kmem_cache_alloc [kmem_cache_alloc_notrace] [kmem_cache_alloc_trace] __get_free_pages get_zeroed_page [__kmalloc_node] [kmem_cache_alloc_node] [kmem_cache_alloc_node_notrace] [kmem_cache_alloc_node_trace] [__alloc_pages_nodemask] [alloc_pages_current] [alloc_pages_exact]
All these functions use shared fault simulation point with name __kmalloc, which provides parameters size (of type size_t) and flags (of type gfp_t) for fault simulation scenario.

kedr_fsim_mem_util.ko
kstrdup kstrndup kmemdup
Fault simulation points for this functions do not provide additional parameter for fault simulation scenario.

kedr_fsim_vmm.ko
vmalloc __vmalloc vmalloc_user vmalloc_node vmalloc_32 vmalloc_32_user
All these functions use shared fault simulation point with name vmalloc, which provides no additional parameters for fault simulation scenario.
